metadata.title: CVE-2018-1061 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
python before versions 2.7.15, 3.4.9, 3.5.6rc1, 3.6.5rc1 and 3.7.0 is vulnerable to catastrophic backtracking in the difflib.IS_LINE_JUNK method.  An attacker could use this flaw to cause denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-1061` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
python2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.15-4ubuntu1').
